comments:
Hi,

sorry I had to come back from ticket https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=14941 . I tried the option -ignoreMissingPlugins als follows:

java -cp /usr/local/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main  \
     -application  org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate \
     -command mirror \
     -from http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/  \
     -to /home/here/mirror \
     -mirrorURL http://mirror/ \
     -ignoreMissingPlugins

I always get the following error (with or without/ -ignoreMissingPlugins)

!MESSAGE Unable to retrieve remote reference "http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk.sola
ris.x86_3.2.0.HEAD.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/
releases/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk.solaris.x86_3.2.0.HEAD.jar.]
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FatalIOException: Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk.solaris.x86_3.2.0.HEAD.jar.
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.UpdateManagerUtils.checkConnectionResult(UpdateManagerUtils.java:558)
        at org.eclipse.update.core.ContentReference.getInputStream(ContentReference.java:153)
        at 
...

Regards,
Dirk

Sorry, I made a wrong reference to the previous ticket:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=149415

is that a new option in 3.3?  Is there a corresponding systme property that one can set in config.ini?  In general we are trying to avoid introducing command line options as they are rather hard to manage.
